page.title: 05FETE:HINTON CHARTERHOUSE
page.content: IN PREVIOUS YEARS IN{HINTON {CHARTERHOUSE,}VARIOUS ORGANISATIONS WISHED TO HOLD ANNUAL FETES. MEMBERS OF THE WOMEN'S LEAGUE, THE BRITISH LEGION AND THE LOCAL YOUTH CLUB ALL CAME TO THE DOOR WITH RAFFLE TICKETS FOR SALE, SO ONE YEAR IT WAS DECIDED TO HOLD A JOINT FETE, WITH THE GROUPS WHO WISH TO CONTRIBUTE SHARING IN THE PROFITS. THIS IS HELD ON THE FIRST SATURDAY IN JULY EVERY YEAR, AT THE CRICKET GROUND. THERE IS A MEETING AFTER THE EVENT TO DISTRIBUTE TO EACH GROUP A PERCENTAGE OF THE TAKINGS. OTHER ORGANISATIONS INCLUDE A TUFTY CLUB, TWO FOOTBALL TEAMS, A CRICKET TEAM AND A HOCKEY TEAM, ALL OF WHICH CONTRIBUTE TO VILLAGE LIFE. ANOTHER EVENT IS THE ANNUAL VISIT TO HINTON HOUSE OF ONE HUNDRED BLIND PEOPLE FROM ST.DUNSTAN'S ON A DAY'S OUTING.
